What is Sass

Sass is a CSS preprocessor program that can be used, in conjunction with a compiler, to generate CSS for your web pages. As the complexity and/or size of a website grows, the more likely it can benefit from the use of Sass to generate CSS.

Features of Sass

Sass offers features that are not native to CSS. The navigation menu above leads to more indepth descriptions or examples of these features, including: variables, nested syntax, partials and mixins to name a few.

Using Sass

The styling of this website was created using Sass. The set-up shown here included: Gulp (compiler), Visual Studio Code (code editor) and Sass (css preprocessor). Although the set-up can be a time-consuming the first time around, it is worth the effort.
